content: Small typo: AV - and - AV start with 4-3 and 3-4, not 5-4 and 4-5 (cf validator 2).

Il y a une erreur dans le test et le validateur "best of three"
D.Parry B.Krejcikova
3
7F FF 4B 35 CA EE 75 8B 11 02 01 96 B6 A5 75 00 1E 12 60

D.Parry........ 1 6 6
B.Krejcikova... 6 2 3
D.Parry win

(je n'ai pas tout vérifié !)

Ce devrait être 5 et non pas 3

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting exercise that has a real life use.

The numerous tests really helped me out, as I wasn't able to understand the tie-break rule from the statement (because I know so little about tennis)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think that's a good exercise to string manipulation, HEX to Binary conversion, conditionals and more.
Really nice problem, but, like other people here, I think that's medium difficult. Did in golang with 172 lines of code. Well done!

I like it but it's definitely not easy.
It took you 77 lines of Python, could be way more in other langages.
The formatting of both input and output are too complex for a quick easy exercise.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle for a Sunday afternoon.
Very thorough set of test/validation cases.
I think this is better than the average "Easy" puzzle on CG.

Small wording suggestions:

In Tie-break rules:
The winner of the game then wins the set on the score 7 5. (should be 7 6)

In Output Lines 1 and 2:
. . . the games won . . .  should be
. . .the games won in each completed set, the games won in the current set . . .
(feel free to ignore this suggestion)

In Output Lines 1 and 2:
rather than "his name" you could say "player name" or "his/her name" or "their name".

A fun puzzle for tennis fans.
I agree it's an Easy puzzle, though still challenging.

Just some comments about the Statement.
Sorry about the length of these comments.

I think the "Goal" is:
"Given a record of points scored in a tennis match, determine the current score, whether the match is complete, and who won."

In addition to describing a normal game and set, describe a normal match. "The maximum number of sets in a match is either 3 or 5. The player who wins a majority of the sets wins the match."

In the "Normal" game section, consider moving the deuce and advantage scoring into the Tie-break section. You could give examples like scores of 4-4, 5-5, 6-6 are reported as 40 40 and scores with a 1 point advantage are reported as AV - or  - AV. 

In a normal tennis game, I would say "you must score at least 4 points, with at least 2 points more than your opponent."

When you describe a "Normal" set you write "To win a normal tennis game". Should be "To win a normal tennis set"

In the "Normal" set section the scoring description isn't quite right. After the score reaches 6-5 the next score is either 7-5 (first player wins the set) or 6-6 (set tie-breaker). When one player wins the tie-break the set score is either 6-7 or 7-6. You should probably mention that the score in the tie-break is unlimited.

In the description of Line 3 for the Input, I would say "Each point in the match is represented by a sequence of binary digits: 0 if the first player won the point, or 1 if the second player won the point." You may want to indicate that points consists of pairs of hex digits separated by spaces.

Sorry I ran out of time before I could test it in the IDE.
Next time.

Looks good to me but I don't have much time for deep testing right now.
Few typos:
'Analyse' should be 'Analysis'
'wins' sounds better than 'win'
Thx for typos !

Je me disais qu'il y avait peut-être la possibilité de calculer la fin du match d'une autre manière qu'en comptant le nombre de sets gagnés...
Très plaisant à faire sinon, bravo !
Indeed, as I said the exercise is interesting and I like it.
ok, now it's a medium exercise !
